jobs.title: Founding Recruiter
jobs.descriptionHtml:
What we're doing

Sola is building an agentic automation platform to support the enterprises of tomorrow. In order to deliver the experience we want, we’ve reimagined enterprise process automation to effortlessly and safely apply foundation AI models at scale across web and desktop interfaces.

In just one year, Sola has been adopted by Fortune 500 companies, top U.S. law firms, and some of the largest private enterprises across industries like finance, healthcare, legal, and supply chain.

Our team is based in NYC and includes industry leaders who have built and scaled businesses, contributed to the largest quantitative funds, crypto projects, and research labs, and have been founders themselves. We’ve raised our Series A from a Tier-1 VC and Conviction, with additional backing from the founders and CEOs of Dropbox, Zoom, Zapier, Scale, and more.

Sola’s workflow automation product is just the first step – our hardest challenges lie ahead. If you’re excited to solve some of the world’s most critical automation problems, we’d love to hear from you.

Who we are

Sola was founded in 2023 by Jessica Wu and Neil Deshmukh, who were previously at MIT and have experienced firsthand the RPA pain point within their previous experiences in finance and healthcare (prev. at IBM-Watson, MGH, BWH, Citadel Securities, Goldentree AM), and have extensive research experience in relevant areas (published in NeurIps/IEEE for research on multimodal models, computer vision, and robotics).

We’ve raised 20M+ in funding to date (most recently a Series A from a Tier-1 VC and Conviction), with additional backing from Y Combinator (S23 batch) and the founders and CEOs of Dropbox, Zoom, Zapier, Scale, and more.

What you’ll be doing

As a Founding Recruiter, you will:

  • Build and manage full-cycle recruiting pipelines across technical and non-technical roles

  • Own sourcing - writing great outreach, tracking funnel performance, and adapting quickly

  • Partner directly with hiring managers (including the CEO) to define needs, set strategy, and close top talent

  • Clearly communicate Sola’s mission and momentum to candidates - getting them excited to join early

  • Deliver a thoughtful, high-touch candidate experience from first message to final offer

Qualifications

We are looking for applicants with these skills:

  • 2–5 years of in-house recruiting experience, including at least 2 years focused on technical roles

  • Proven ability to source and close top engineering talent, especially for hard-to-fill roles

  • Are familiar with the AI/ML talent landscape

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

  • Must be available in NYC

Benefits

🌇 Where: Strongly preferred in-person (NYC) with covered relocation. We believe the best work happens in person!

💸 Compensation: We hire exceptional people and pay them well. Every role includes competitive salary and meaningful equity

🩺 Healthcare: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage on par with Big Tech

📈 401k: Easy enrollment with smart options to help you save for the future

🍽️ Meals: Daily lunches, dinners, and snacks so you can stay focused on work

🏝️Time Off: Up to four weeks of flexible PTO

jobs.title: Technical Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
tldr;

Sola is looking for a Technical Product Manager to lead the development of AI-powered features from idea to launch. You’ll work closely with the CEO, designer, and engineering team to define roadmap, shape product direction, and drive execution on features that solve real customer problems.

The right candidate has strong product instincts, technical profiency, and a bias toward clear decisions and fast execution. You take full ownership, bridging technical depth with product clarity, with the ability to speak both for users and on behalf of engineering.

You should also bring a high bar for product taste and obsess over UX details.

What we're doing

Sola is building an agentic automation platform to support the enterprises of tomorrow. In order to deliver the experience we want, we’ve reimagined enterprise process automation to effortlessly and safely apply foundation AI models at scale across web and desktop interfaces.

Some topics we’ve gone deep on include AI-enabled error correction algorithms, Markov Decision Models using AI inputs, agentic workflow orchestrators, AI desktop infrastructure, and more.

In just one year, Sola has been adopted by Fortune 500 companies, top U.S. law firms, and some of the largest private enterprises across industries like finance, healthcare, legal, and supply chain.

Our team is based in NYC and includes industry leaders who have built and scaled businesses, contributed to the largest quantitative funds, crypto projects, and research labs, and have been founders themselves. We’ve raised our Series A from a Tier-1 VC and Conviction, with additional backing from the founders and CEOs of Dropbox, Zoom, Zapier, Scale, and more.

Sola’s workflow automation product is just the first step – our hardest challenges lie ahead. If you’re excited to solve some of the world’s most critical automation problems, we’d love to hear from you.

Who we are

Sola was founded in 2023 by Jessica Wu and Neil Deshmukh, who were previously at MIT and have experienced firsthand the RPA pain point within their previous experiences in finance and healthcare (prev. at IBM-Watson, MGH, BWH, Citadel Securities, Goldentree AM), and have extensive research experience in relevant areas (published in NeurIps/IEEE for research on multimodal models, computer vision, and robotics).

We’ve most recently raised a Series A from a Tier-1 VC and Conviction, with additional backing from Y Combinator (S23 batch) and the founders and CEOs of Dropbox, Zoom, Zapier, Scale, and more.

What you’ll be doing

As a Technical Product Manager, you will:

  • Work closely with the CEO, designer, and engineering team to define strategy and execution for high-impact features

  • Build, own, and maintain the product roadmap, balancing near-term priorities with long-term vision

  • Drive features end-to-end: define requirements, write clear specs, align stakeholders, and ensure smooth communication between design, engineering, and go-to-market

  • Talk to users regularly to understand pain points, gather feedback, and identify opportunities to deliver more value

  • Stay sharp on emerging AI capabilities and help the team prioritize what’s valuable, feasible, and differentiated

  • Help shape the internal tooling, metrics, and feedback loops that support rapid iteration and high-quality decision-making

Qualifications

We are looking for applicants with these skills:

  • 4+ years of product management experience working on technical products, ideally with some time at an early-stage startup

  • Prior track record of shipping 0 → 1, user-facing features that required close collaboration with engineering and design

  • Sharp product judgment with a high bar for quality and UX, combined with strong technical fluency

  • Clear, concise communicator who can bring structure to ambiguity and drive alignment across technical and non-technical teams. You can represent engineering tradeoffs clearly and earn the trust of multiple stakeholders.

  • Bias toward speed, ownership, and high-quality decision-making in fast-moving environments

  • Bonus: experience with AI/ML products, automation software, or internal tools with strong end-user requirements or enterprise customers

  • Must be available in NYC

Benefits

🌇 Where: Strongly preferred in-person (NYC) with covered relocation. We believe the best work happens in person!

💸 Compensation: We hire exceptional people and pay them well. Every role includes competitive salary and meaningful equity

🩺 Healthcare: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage on par with Big Tech

📈 401k: Easy enrollment with smart options to help you save for the future

🍽️ Meals: Daily lunches, dinners, and snacks so you can stay focused on work

🏝️Time Off: Up to four weeks of flexible PTO

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer (Fullstack)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Sola

Sola is building the agentic automation platform powering the enterprises of tomorrow. Founded in 2023 by Jessica Wu and Neil Deshmukh (MIT alums, ex-IBM Watson, Citadel Securities, MGH/BWH), we’ve raised a Series A from a Tier-1 VC and Conviction, with backing from Y Combinator (S23) and the founders of Dropbox, Zoom, Zapier, Scale, and more.

In just one year, Sola has been adopted by Fortune 500s, top U.S. law firms, and leading private enterprises across finance, healthcare, legal, and supply chain.

Our team in NYC includes industry leaders who have built and scaled world-class businesses, contributed to top quant funds, crypto projects, and research labs—and been founders themselves.

What We’re Building

We’ve reimagined enterprise process automation to safely and effortlessly apply foundation AI models across web and desktop interfaces at scale. Our work spans:

  • AI-enabled error correction algorithms

  • Agentic workflow orchestration

  • Markov decision models with AI inputs

  • AI desktop infrastructure

Our workflow automation product is just the beginning—the hardest challenges are still ahead.

If you’re excited to bring Figma-level UI/UX excellence to automation and build trusted tools for mission-critical processes, we’d love to meet you.

What You’ll Do

As a Senior Full-Stack Engineer, you’ll:

  • Own the full lifecycle of features—from customer request to code in production

  • Make thoughtful tradeoffs across frontend and backend when designing systems

  • Build fast, reliable client-side features to record and create workflow automations

  • Integrate with backend APIs to run and monitor automations

  • Partner with product and design to craft intuitive, delightful user experiences

What We’re Looking For

  • Fluency in Typescript, Python, and React (all required)

  • 4+ years of experience writing high-quality production code with monitoring and reporting

  • Prior experience at a Seed or Series A startup

  • Strong background in client-side technologies and platforms

  • Proven ability to collaborate with designers, PMs, engineers, and customers to break down high-level goals into shippable work

  • Must be available in NYC (we’ll cover relocation)

Benefits

🌇 Where: In-person in NYC (we believe the best work happens together)
💸 Compensation: Competitive salary + meaningful equity
🩺 Healthcare: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision (Big Tech level)
📈 401k: Easy enrollment with smart savings options
🍽️ Meals: Daily lunches, dinners, and snacks
🏝️ Time Off: Up to 4 weeks flexible PTO

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer (Backend)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Sola

Sola is building the agentic automation platform powering the enterprises of tomorrow. Founded in 2023 by Jessica Wu and Neil Deshmukh (MIT alums, ex-IBM Watson, Citadel Securities, MGH/BWH), we’ve raised $21M in total funding from a16z and Conviction, with additional backing from Y Combinator (S23) and the founders of Dropbox, Zoom, Zapier, Scale, and more.

In just one year, Sola has been adopted by Fortune 500s, top U.S. law firms, and leading private enterprises across finance, healthcare, legal, and supply chain.

Our team in NYC includes industry leaders who have built and scaled world-class businesses, contributed to top quant funds, crypto projects, and research labs—and been founders themselves.

What We’re Building

We’ve reimagined enterprise process automation to safely and effortlessly apply foundation AI models across web and desktop interfaces at scale. Our work spans:

  • AI-enabled error correction algorithms

  • Agentic workflow orchestration

  • Markov decision models with AI inputs

  • AI desktop infrastructure

Our workflow automation product is just the beginning—the hardest challenges are still ahead.

If you’re excited to bring Figma-level UI/UX excellence to automation and build trusted tools for mission-critical processes, we’d love to meet you.

As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will:

  • Own systems that automate repetitive work across hundreds of browser and desktop platforms, handling concurrency, reliability, and observability at scale

  • Collaborate with our CTO and ML research partners to bring state-of-the-art agentic workflows into production

  • Architect and scale backend infrastructure to power our visual workflow builder – a Figma-style interface used daily by non-technical ops teams

  • Design and implement services that integrate with cutting-edge AI models to generate workflows, parse documents, and drive adaptive execution logic

  • Deploy and manage services in Kubernetes, ensuring scalability, resilience, and performance in production environments

What We’re Looking For

  • Fluency in Typescript and Python (both required)

  • Hands-on experience with Kubernetes (designing, deploying, and scaling production services)

  • 4+ years of experience building scalable distributed systems at enterprise scale (the more battle scars, the better)

  • Prior experience at an early-stage startup

  • Proven ability to collaborate with engineers and PMs to break down high-level goals into shippable milestones

  • Must be available in NYC (we’ll cover relocation)

  • Nice to have: prior experience with distributed workflow orchestration such as Cadence or Temporal.io

Benefits

🌇 Where: In-person in NYC (we believe the best work happens together)
💸 Compensation: Competitive salary + meaningful equity
🩺 Healthcare: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision (Big Tech level)
📈 401k: Easy enrollment with smart savings options
🍽️ Meals: Daily lunches, dinners, and snacks
🏝️ Time Off: Up to 4 weeks flexible PTO

👉 Join us if you want to shape the future of automation, push the boundaries of AI-driven systems, and work shoulder-to-shoulder with a world-class NYC team.
